title: The rist consists simply of a beam into which a coulter is attached. The normal plow frame with sole, share, and moldboard are missing. It was still used in parts of Scotland, Norway, Sweden, Finland, and the Alps as late as the eighteenth and nineteenth centuries for the cutting of roots before plowing or when clearing new areas. Descriptions by Roman authors, illustrations from medieval French books, and philological studies suggest that the rist may have existed across large parts of Europe since ancient times.
